material.mattext: The following schematic diagram represents the fractional distillation of crude oil (crude petroleum) in industry. The letters A to E denote different products obtained from the distillation.
Question: Which one of the fractions A to E has the lowest boiling point range?
Which one of the substances listed below is not an element ?

What is the change in oxidation number (oxidation state, valency) of manganese in the reaction represented by the following equation:

MnO2 + 4HCl  â†’  MnCl2 + Cl2 + 2H2O
For each of these statements, select whether it is True or False.
Ions are particles with an electric charge.
When an atom loses electrons, it becomes a negative ion.
There are always electrons in the negative ion.
Alkali metals are reactive and form the +1 ions.
Positive and negative ions attract each other.
Which of the following substances are liquid at room temperature and standard pressure?
Which of the following does not lead to an increase in the nitrogen content of soil?
The process whereby hydrocarbons of high molecular mass are converted into hydrocarbons of low molecular mass is called:
The ability to conduct electricity readily is a property of ...
How is the presence of ions in an aqueous solution most directly detected?
By finding out if it conducts electricity.
By measuring the density of the solution and comparing it with the density of pure water.
By measuring whether the solution has an electric charge.
By evaporating the solution and testing the residue for conductivity.
By adding an ionic substance to the solution and seeing whether there is a reaction.
The main component of paper is ...

A sample of an aqueous sodium chloride solution containing 8 g of sodium chloride in 100 ml of solution is concentrated to half of its original volume.
How many grams of sodium chloride are contained in 25 ml of the new solution?
The relative atomic mass of carbon (C) is about 12. Approximately, how many atoms are contained in 6 g of carbon?

What is the minimum weight of sodium chloride (NaCl) that is needed to prepare 7.10 g of chlorine ?

Relative atomic masses:  Na = 23.0 ; Cl = 35.5
For each of the following statements, you are asked to decide whether it is True or False.
There are only three atoms in one ammonia molecule (NH3).
The formula of hydrogen chloride is HClO4.
Sodium chloride readily dissolves in water.

The graph below shows the solubilities (in g solute/100 ml water) of sodium nitrate and sodium chloride at different temperatures. Refer to it to answer this question.

100 g of sodium nitrate and 100 g of sodium chloride are added to 100 cm3 of water at 60Â°C. The mixture is stirred until no more solid dissolves. It is then filtered, keeping the temperature at 60Â°C.
What is the residue left on the filter paper ?
From the following, select the three bases that are most commonly used in the chemical industry.
Apart from carbon, proteins always contain:

According to the chemical reactivity series, metals can displace other metals from their solutions.Which of the following metals will displace copper from its solution?

Gold - Iron - Magnesium - Silver - Zinc

item.title: 019 160. An aqueous solution of sodium io

material.mattext:
An aqueous solution of sodium iodide is electrolysed with platinum electrodes.

What is the main product at the cathode (negative electrode) ?
Correct statements about the material known as 'PVC' include:
When PVC is burnt, only carbon dioxide and water are produced.

item.title: 021 96. The two nonmetals in the f

material.mattext: The two non-metals in the following group are:

The following are important methods of separation used in chemistry:

Chromatography - Crystallisation - Distillation - Filtration - Sublimation

Select the best method for the separation of the substances in each of the following cases.
Separating sand from a sand/salt mixture.
Separating water from a sample of ink.
Separating a dye from a mixture of dyes.
Separating pure iodine from a sample of impure iodine.
Separating ethanol from an sample of ethanol in water.

When marble pieces are added to hydrochloric acid, the following reaction takes place:

CaCO3(s) + 2HCl(aq)   â†’   CaCl2(aq) + H2O(l) + CO2(g)

Which of the following actions would increase the rate of formation of carbon dioxide?
Reducing the size of the marble pieces
Using nitric acid instead of hydrochloric acid
Collecting the carbon dioxide in a gas cylinder
Compounds that have high melting points, conduct electricity in the molten phase and are often soluble in water are
From the list, select the gases that can be collected using the apparatus shown in the diagram on the left.
Oxides which produce alkaline solutions when mixed with water include:
Calculate how many moles of ethanoic acid (CH3COOH: relative molecular mass 60) may be produced from 92 g of ethanol (CH3CH2OH: relative molecular mass 46).
The reaction between zinc (Zn) and hydrochloric acid produces...
Complete the following statements by choosing the appropriate terms under the selector button.
A substance which conducts electricity in aqueous solution is a(n) ...
The process by which an electric current produces a chemical change is ...
The electrode at which oxidation occurs is called a(n) ...
The electrode at which reduction occurs is called a(n) ...
The flow or movement of electrons through a conductor is a(n) ...
Which of the following would yield the greatest amount of useful energy ?
1 kg of uranium in a nuclear plant.
1 kg of water dropped 100 m in a hydroelectric plant.
1 kg of grass fed to a horse working in the field.
1 h of sunshine over a photo voltaic plant of 1 km2 surface.
1 litre of petrol (gasoline) used as fuel in a motor.
